channel.title: Sisters laptop RAM
channel.description:
So to hammer home the point that we need a board for computer questions:
My sisters laptop is slow as fuck, its got a 1.6ghz Pentium processor with 256mb ram. I've got rid of all the shit to see if it sped up at all and it hasn't so I decided the first stop is to buy some new ram.
So I found that 2gb ram would be about £30 and 1gb ram would be £15, each of these is fine but will I see that much of a difference in performance in just a ram change or is it a lost cause? (As I cannot be fucked to find a way to upgrade the laptops processor)
DISCUSS

item.title: Sisters laptop RAM
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“IP-Drowner, post:10, topic:222978”][quote author=vbcoderx link=topic=292871.msg2365399#msg2365399 date=1217909860]
i wouldn’t recommend overclocking your laptop processor unless its a gaming laptop, such as a dell XPS M1770
[/quote]
How can you overcock a laptop?[/quote]
A vacuum pump will help to overcock a laptop.

Read full topic

item.title: Sisters laptop RAM
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Im on my old dell latitude l400.
256mb ram
700mhz cpu
it has vista, xp and xp micro.

No lag at all… (Vista has a bit)

The xp micro boots in 2.4bars.
Uses 42mb ram on standstill.

Read full topic

item.title: Sisters laptop RAM
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

First, use a Registry Fixer and repair registry errors. Those can help increase the performance If it doesn’t work, go with the RAM

A good registry cleaner is called Advanced System Optimizer Go with that, it has a free 15-day trial to it

Read full topic

item.title: Sisters laptop RAM
item.dc:creator: @Hiaburi Hiaburi
item.description:
@Hiaburi wrote:

well i built two computers recently, one for my bros friend and one for him, they are both the same accept he has 128 megs more ram from like 286 or so to 360 something i think, cant really remember atm and there is a huge diff, they both play this game called club penguin, on hers it laggs horribly and on his it runs fine. same internet and all, just different ram.

Read full topic

item.title: Sisters laptop RAM
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

Overclock the CPU by 10-20%, Get 1-2gig ram, Put your OS in low detailed mode (classic mode if your on windows) Clean your reg, remove desktop icons and put them in a folder, start > run > msconfig > startup tab > untick everything you dont want starting up and using memory while idling.

Then it will be fast.

Read full topic

item.title: Sisters laptop RAM
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

You’ll notice a massive difference upgrading the RAM, imo.

My desktop is still rockin a 1.8ghz cpu, i noticed a difference even going 512mb->768mb RAM, so I’m sure 256-1/2gb would be noticable, whatever tasks you happen to be doing on it.

Read full topic

item.title: Sisters laptop RAM
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Processor is alright, nothing amazing, but I’d at least put 1gb of ram into it and you should be running a lot faster. If not you might have to update the processor.

Read full topic

item.title: Sisters laptop RAM
item.dc:creator: @reVein reVein
item.description:
@reVein wrote:

Buy a 2gb ram and overclock the CPU.

Read full topic
